info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 2:34PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Tehama and south central Shasta Counties through 345 PM PDT... At 231 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lakehead to 7 miles west of Rosewood. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Pea size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. The line of thunderstorms is nearly stationary with torrential rain. This could cause flooding of roads and streams. Locations impacted include... Redding, Shasta Dam, Shasta Lake, Sugarloaf, Keswick, Central Valley, Whiskeytown, Centerville, Central Valley Cdp, Igo, Ono, O`brien, Mountain Gate, Lakehead and Lakehead-Lakeshore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
